title: Wanderers Special Club
text:
Wanderers Special Club (often abbreviated as Wanderers SC) were a <a href="Association%20football">football</a> club based in <a href="Auckland">Auckland</a>, New Zealand.
The team was age-restricted, and featured only players below 20 years of age. The club was formed to develop players for the <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20under-20%20football%20team">New Zealand national under-20 football team</a> in preparation for the then up-coming <a href="2015%20FIFA%20U-20%20World%20Cup">2015 FIFA U-20 World Cup</a>, hosted in New Zealand. New Zealand Football High Performance Director <a href="Fred%20de%20Jong">Fred de Jong</a> said that "one of the objectives is to retain our top young players in New Zealand for longer, and entry into the <a href="ASB%20Premiership">ASB Premiership</a> gives us an opportunity to prepare in a cost effective manner when compared to touring the team internationally."
The club is considered to be a continuation of Northern-Based, an under-17 team that played in the <a href="National%20Youth%20League%20%28New%20Zealand%29">ASB Youth League</a> and provided several players to New Zealand for the <a href="2013%20OFC%20U-17%20Championship">2013 OFC U-17 Championship</a>.
The team entered the <a href="2013%E2%80%9314%20ASB%20Premiership">2013–14 ASB Premiership</a> season, replacing outgoing <a href="YoungHeart%20Manawatu">YoungHeart Manawatu</a>.
The team was withdrawn from the ASB Premiership following the completion of the <a href="2014%E2%80%9315%20ASB%20Premiership">2014–15</a> season.
